This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

app/layout.tsx.name: layout.tsx
app/layout.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines the top-level layout structure and global metadata for the entire Next.js application. Integrates global styles and typography configurations to establish a consistent visual baseline for all routes.

app/page.tsx.name: page.tsx
app/page.tsx.upperLevelSummary:
Renders the application's primary landing page featuring a centered calculator interface.
Serves as the root route entry point by integrating the core Calculator component and local styles.

components/Button.tsx.name: Button.tsx
components/Button.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component renders a customizable calculator button supporting multiple visual variants and click interactions. It utilizes CSS modules for styling and serves as a fundamental building block for the ButtonGrid component.

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.name: ButtonGrid.tsx

metadata.firstNLines:
import Button from "./Button";
import styles from "./ButtonGrid.module.css";

interface ButtonGridProps {
    onButtonClick: (value: string) => void;
}

/**
 * Calculator button grid component
 * Arranges buttons in a 4x5 grid layout
 */
export default function ButtonGrid({ onButtonClick }: ButtonGridProps) {
    const buttons = [
        { value: "C", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "±", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "%", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "÷", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "7", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "8", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "9", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "×", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "4", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "5", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "6", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "-", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "1", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "2", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "3", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "+", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "0", variant: "number" as const, wide: true },

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Renders a 4x5 grid of calculator buttons and manages click interactions through a provided callback function. It is used by the Calculator component and depends on the Button component and CSS modules for layout.

components/Calculator.tsx.name: Calculator.tsx
components/Calculator.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component manages the state and core logic for the main calculator interface. It coordinates display and button subcomponents while utilizing external utility functions to process mathematical operations.

components/Display.tsx.name: Display.tsx
components/Display.tsx.upperLevelSummary:
Renders the current input value and calculation history for a calculator interface.
Used by the main Calculator component and depends on local CSS modules for styling.

eslint.config.mjs.name: eslint.config.mjs
eslint.config.mjs.upperLevelSummary: Configures project-wide ESLint rules and global ignore patterns by extending Next.js and TypeScript standards. It exports the primary configuration object used by the linter to enforce code quality across the application.

lib/calculator.ts.name: calculator.ts

lib/calculator.ts.upperLevelSummary: Implements pure mathematical functions and input processing logic for basic calculator operations. Provides core computational utilities to the Calculator component with no external dependencies.

next.config.ts.name: next.config.ts
next.config.ts.upperLevelSummary: Configures framework behavior and environment settings for the Next.js application. Provides the primary configuration object used by the build system and runtime.

{

    "target": "ES2017",
    "lib": ["dom", "dom.iterable", "esnext"],
    "allowJs": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "strict": true,

  },

.nexhacks.name: .nexhacks
.nexhacks.upperLevelSummary: This directory serves as the central configuration and metadata hub for the Nexhacks system. It manages modular functional units and environment settings via the `capsules.json` registry file.

..name: calculator
..upperLevelSummary: This is the root directory of a Next.js web application built with TypeScript and ESLint. It centralizes project-wide configurations, core application routing, reusable UI components, and shared utility libraries.

app.name: app
app.upperLevelSummary: This directory serves as the application's root entry point, defining the global layout and styling architecture. It renders the primary landing page which features a centralized calculator interface as the core functionality.

components.name: components
components.upperLevelSummary: This directory houses the modular UI components and core orchestration logic required to build a functional calculator interface. Key functionalities include state management for mathematical operations, a structured grid for user input, and a dedicated display for results and history.

lib.name: lib
lib.upperLevelSummary: This directory serves as the core utility layer for mathematical logic and computational processing. It provides pure functions for arithmetic operations and input processing utilities designed for calculator components.

public.name: public
public.upperLevelSummary: This directory serves as the storage location for static assets and data files accessible to the application's frontend. It contains structured JSON data used to populate and manage public-facing content.
